name: TubeDroid
description:
The game is about getting to the max score as quick as possible by collecting objects in the void, careful some objects cause damage and some can even take your score away.

the colored  space spheres can be turned into unique shapes to help with color blindness the option should be set active by default.

CONTROLS

W,S moves along tube

A,D rotates around tube

SPACE jumps

M or ESC open menu

Xbox controller should also work with this game

left joy moves forward and back along tube

right joy rotates A button or right shoulder jumps

menu button opens menu

Game has a tutorial level with text bubbles giving info on the objects and game.

Windows

Ue4 prerequisite may need to be installed they should come with game by default and will auto start first time you try and play.
Tested sandbox mode for the itch.io APP it dose not seem to like it at the moment at least on my end.

HTML5

HTML5 D-pad navigates the menu. Xbox joystick wont work.

HTML5 Input can become consumed inconstantly on itch's html5 window. To fix this, hit ESC or click the full screen button then ESC again. Not sure why this happens here on Itch.

HTML5 is intended for desktop web browsers.

ANDROID

ANDROID CURRENT STATUS = some PROTOTYPING install process is a bit wonky, Tested on a Pixel2.

Android uses on screen controls, but can use tilt sensors as well by enabling them in options menu.

Install process ANDROID:

Download APK to phone. It will ask if the location of the downloaded file is OK to install from. If you accept, you then are asked one more time if an unrecognized install is OK. Once that is done, game should install . CAUTION: this install is not done through an app store. Its more akin to the old way of installing software

Always be wary of apps, no matter the source. If you don't like they way this installs, don't install it.
